results.title: Electricity: The Story
results.brief_description: An animated film that features a character called “Electro”. Electro explains what electricity is, how it is generated, and the way it is transmitted from a power station to the home. The film outlines the uses and the safety aspects of electricity.
results.description: An animated film that features a character called “Electro”. Electro explains what electricity is, how it is generated, and the way it is transmitted from a power station to the home. The film outlines the uses and the safety aspects of electricity.

results.title: Electricity: generation and distribution
results.brief_description: Episode 6 of the series “Is this job for me” on the electricity supply industry. The jobs in the industry are shown by tracing the apprenticeships of two boys who went to the same school; one who enters the generating side and the other the distribution side of industry.

results.title: Electricity: a first film
results.creator_credit: Norman Bean Films and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Shows how electricity works, how it is generated, and the ways in which it can be utilised. Also demonstrates principles involved in making electromagnets, and safety precautions with electricity. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Electricity in agriculture
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Eric Thompson and Jack Rogers

results.title: Electricity from chemicals
results.brief_description: Explains chemical reactions which produce electric current in a simplified electric cell. Discusses dry cell, nickel-cadmium and lead storage batteries. Introduces such terms as ion, charge and electrode. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Explains chemical reactions which produce electric current in a simplified electric cell. Discusses dry cell, nickel-cadmium and lead storage batteries. Introduces such terms as ion, charge and electrode. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Electricity and movement
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Frank A. Hoare and John Durst
results.brief_description: The basic principles of the electric motor. Opens with an account of the properties of magnets. Compares the action of permanent magnets and electro-magnets. An electro-magnet is used to work an electric bell. An electro-magnet is then adapted so that it turns on an axle and, in this way, the development of a simple electric motor is demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Merton Park, Frank A. Hoare and John Durst
results.description: The basic principles of the electric motor. Opens with an account of the properties of magnets. Compares the action of permanent magnets and electro-magnets. results.title: Electricity and light
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Frank A. Hoare and John Durst
results.brief_description: Explains how electrical energy is transformed into light by three methods - the filament lamp, the arc lamp, and the discharge tube. The film considers each type detail.

results.title: Electricity and heat
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Frank A. Hoare and Langton Gould-Marks
results.brief_description: The heating effect of an electric current is shown to be a clue to agitation of the aubital electrons; the difference between series and modern applications of electric heating are demonstrated.

results.title: Electricity
results.creator_credit: Television Ontario, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and David Chamberlain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Addresses the fundamentals of electrostatics and current electricity, helping students to form images of abstract concepts. The first three programs on electrostatics explains the charging of objects by contact and induction. The last three episodes on current electricity looks at electrical charge, current flow, potentail difference and resistance.
